00002 /*  list.h                                          */
00003 /*  Header file for Double-Link unordered list      */
00004 /*                                                  */  
00005 /****************************************************/
00006 
00007 #include <stdio.h>
00008 #include <stdlib.h>
00009 #include <string.h>
00010 #ifndef _HASH_INT_LIST_
00011 #define _HASH_INT_LIST_
00012 
00013 typedef struct node 
00014 {
00015     unsigned long     key;
00016     int             value;
00017 
00018     struct node  *   prev;
00019     struct node     *next;
00020 } node;
00021 
00022 class HashLink {
00023 
00024 public:
00025   /****************** CONSTRUCTORS-DISTRUCTORS ****************/
00026   /* Returns a h_listptr which point to a new empty h_list */
00027   HashLink();
00028   /* Frees all the memory associated with h_listptr* argument
00029          and sets * lptr to NULL */
00030   ~HashLink();
00031   
00032   
00033   int h_remove_node( unsigned long key, int value);
00034 
00035   /******************* ACCESS FUNCTIONS *********************/
00036   /* Returns true if h_list contains no element */
00037   int h_is_empty(); 
00038   
00039   /* get value at the given key, if key exists */
00040   int h_get_value_via_key( unsigned long key);
00041   
00042   /* declare whether h_list contains key */
00043   int h_contains_key( unsigned long key);
00044   
00045   /* Returns the first element in the h_list (Pre: !is_empty) */
00046   int h_get_first();
00047   
00048   /* Returns the last element in the h_list (Pre: !is_empty) */
00049   int h_get_last();
00050   
00051   /* Returns the current key in the h_list (Pre: !is_empty Post: !off_end) */
00052   unsigned long h_get_current_key();
00053   
00054   /* Returns the current value in the h_list (Pre: !is_empty Post: !off_end) */
00055   int h_get_current_value();
00056   
00057   /* Returns the length of H_LIST */
00058   int h_get_length();
00059   
00060   /************ MANIPULATION ********************/
00061 /* Adds a new element at the beginning of the h_list 
00062  * post: !is_empty */
00063   void h_insert_before_first(int data, unsigned long key_data);
00064   
00065   /* Deletes the first element
00066    * Pre: !is_empty */
00067   void h_delete_first();
00068   
00069   /* Deletes the last element
00070    * Pre: !is_empty */
00071   void h_delete_last();
00072   
00073   /* Deletes the current element
00074    * Pre: !is_empty, !off_end
00075    * Post: off_end */
00076 void h_delete_current();
00077   
00078   /************* TRAVERSAL *******************************/
00079   /* Returns true if current marker referrs to the first element */
00080   int h_at_first();
00081   
00082   /* Returns true if current marker referrs to the last element */
00083   int h_at_last();
00084   
00085   /* Returns true if no element is current */
00086   int h_off_end();
00087   
00088 /* Makes first element current 
00089  * Pre: !is_empty
00090  * post: !off_end */
00091   void h_move_first();
00092   
00093   /* Makes last element current 
00094    * Pre: !is_empty
00095    * post: !off_end */
00096   void h_move_last();
00097   
00098   /* Moves the current pointer towards the beginning of the h_list 
00099    * Pre: !is_empty &&  !off_end */
00100   void h_move_prev();
00101   
00102   /* Moves the current pointer towards the end of the h_list 
00103    * Pre: !is_empty && !off_end */
00104   void h_move_next();
00105   
00106   /**************** OTHERS OPERATIONS ******************/
00107   
00108   
00109   /* Print out the h_list keys the input h_list */
00110   void print_h_list();
00111   
00112 private:
00113 
00114     int          length;
00115     struct node  *current;
00116     struct node  *head;
00117     struct node  *tail;
00118 };
00119 
00120 #endif
